definition: ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico

sentences.english: Men of letters mostly have a kind of love knot .

sentences.english: The peach blossom world , number men of letters eulogize her , romantic but are rich in poetry.

sentences.english: The beautiful scenery attracted many literati to come here drinking wines and writing poems.
sentences.chinese: 以至許多文人墨客爲之所迷，吟酒作詩。

sentences.english: Let other pens dwell on guilt and misery.

sentences.english: Merlin bamboo chrysanthemum is the flower of ancient men of letters are preferred in the boutique.

definition: to search for the right word (of poet)
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
since ancient times/it has ever been the case that/see also 自古以來|自古以来[zi4 gu3 yi3 lai2]
for all eternity/throughout all ages/eternity (used in an elegiac couplet, wreath etc dedicated to the dead)
romance/beautiful scenery/small or petty (of talk etc)
